title.narrative: Ghana Skills and Technology Development Project

description.narrative: The project objective is to improve demand-driven skills development and increase adoption of new technologies in selected economicsectors.

participating-org.narrative: Council for Technical Vocational Education and Training (COTVET)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article V, 5.01 (a) | Description :Subsidiary Agreement executed on behalf of MOFEP and COTVET | Due Date:12-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Article V, 5.01 (b) | Description :Project Implementation Manual (including SDF manual) submitted to IDA in formand substance satisfactory to Association | Due Date :12-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Article V, 5.01 (c) | Description :Project Accountant, Project Coordinator and Environmental/Social Specialistappointed | Due Date :12-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, C | Description :Accounting system installed, satisfactory to IDA and independentauditors appointed | Due Date :12-Mar-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section III, E.1 | Description :Recruitment of 2 additional procurement officers | Due Date:12-Dec-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section III, E.2 | Description :Training provided to key project procurement staff | Due Date:12-Mar-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV, B.1 (b) | Description :STI Directorate established within Ministry of EnvironmentScience and Technology with mandate, staffing and resources satisfactoryto IDA | Due Date :14-Nov-2011

title.narrative: Information System available for STI Directorate use
COTVET MIS for skills development is functional
Guidelines for quality assurance systems including certification are developed and adopted
National Skills Strategy developed and adopted
STI Directorate established with full complement of staff
Increased proportion of those trained that become certified (disaggregated by gender and age)
Increase in investment by participating enterprises in skills and technology development (disaggregated by economic sectors; size; skills and technology)
New collaborations between supported technology providers and private sector for adaptation and diffusion of technology
Collaborations between enterprises and technology centers (window 4)
Institutional development plans for training providers developed and implemented
New Technologies adopted by participating firms (window 4)
Grant agreements for SDF sub projects signed (Project Management)
Employers rating of competencies of trained employees (Window 1 of SDF)
Satisfaction with skills by participating firms disaggregated by economic sectors; region; size
Satisfaction with skills by trainees (disaggregated by sex, region)
Increase in labor productivity by participating firms disaggregated by economic sector and size (small, medium, large)
